speaker: Frasier
text: This is Dr. Frasier Crane. We'll be right back after this.

speaker: Roz
text: OK, after this spot we're gonna come back in 15 seconds, you do a station ID and then toss it to the news.  I'll count you down.

speaker: Frasier
text: That won't be necessary. I have a built in mental stopwatch. As a child playing "Hide and Go Seek" I was the only one who didn't need to say, "One Hippopotamus Two Hippopotamus."

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I've heard you.  You're always either talking into the news or running short.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not!

speaker: Roz
text: [_taking money out her pocket_] I'll bet you 20 bucks you blow this one.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you're on.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looking at the clock_] No, you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, we're back.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane tuning in for our second hour on the "Dr. Frasier Crane Show."  In our first hour we covered everything from anorexia to xenophobia. What will be next?  As always of course that's entirely up to you.  So stick around -- the Doctor is in and he's listening. [_Frasier finishes, proud with himself until he realises he's forgotten a part and tries to rush it in_] Ooh, this is KACL 780 AM... _The news cuts in over him and he throws down his headphones in disgust.  By this time Kate Costas has walked into the studio._

speaker: Kate
text: That was very smooth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_collecting her money off Frasier_] Oh, let's see.  "One Andrew Jackson, Two Andrew Jackson..."

speaker: Kate
text: Look Frasier, I've been getting a lot of complaints from sponsors saying that their ads are getting buried in huge commercial blocks.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.

speaker: Kate
text: So instead of having four blocks per hour we're going to have eight... _Frasier starts to daydream about Kate and the time he was in the studio with her grappling on the desk.  Kate continues to talk over his daydream._

speaker: Kate
text: ...only they're only going to be half as long.  I thought it might help you.   And you want to stay on top, don't you, Frasier? ...Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, very much so, yes!

speaker: Kate
text: Good.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, what was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: What was what?

speaker: Roz
text: Call me crazy, but when you were talking to Kate you had this goofy little teenage look on your face.  If I didn't know better, I'd swear you got a thing for her.

speaker: Frasier
text: For Kate?

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm.  Look at you.  You're flushed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I had Mexican for lunch.  It's not lust -- it's a Chimichanga.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I'm sorry but I'm never wrong about these things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you lost your mind?

speaker: Roz
text: Look me in the eye and tell me I'm wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking Roz in the eye_] Roz, you're wrong.  [_he turns away at the last minute_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God.  I'm sitting on a powder-keg here.  You've got a crush on Kate!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it.  Everybody knows you are the biggest gossip in the entire station.  You'll be sworn to secrecy.

speaker: Roz
text: I swear I won't tell anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it doesn't count until you shake my hand.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shaking his hand_] Oh, all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Kate and I...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God!  Kate's "Dirty Girl"! _Roz goes hysterical and tries to wrench her hand free, but Frasier won't let go of it._

speaker: Roz
text: Kate is the woman you had sex with on the air in this booth and you were calling "Dirty Girl"?  Oh my God!  I just need a minute.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright.  Of course it happened months ago.  Only a couple of times.

speaker: Roz
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Our relationship started out so antagonistic.  Then suddenly it just spilled over into passion.  Intense, romantic, exciting... _Roz visualises the studio with Frasier and Kate.  Kate is standing in front of Frasier looking at him.  Frasier takes down his trousers and waddles towards Kate before falling flat on his face whilst trying to reach out to her._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...the whole thing's over now, but Roz, you will say nothing, absolutely nothing... Roz?  Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Boy, I'll never do that again! _FADE OUT  Scene 2 -- Frasier's apartment Niles and Daphne are in the kitchen together.  Daphne is grating a carrot whilst Niles looks on. _

speaker: Niles
text: I notice you're grating that carrot at a 45-degree angle. Does that enhance the flavour?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no.  Just an old habit.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  And why exactly did you choose to grate carrots?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_getting annoyed_] Because we have carrots!

speaker: Niles
text: I hope you don't mind all the questions.  It's just now that I'm separated I'm going to have to learn to cook for myself.

speaker: Daphne
text: Quite alright.  Tell you what.  Why don't you grate while I put the chicken in? _Daphne squeezes past Niles towards the oven.  Niles enjoys the "experience."  He then examines the grater._

speaker: Niles
text: Thousands of little metal teeth able to tear the flesh right off your... _Niles goes to grate the carrot but grates his finger instead.  He pulls back in pain and knocks Daphne who drops one of the chickens, which was to go in the oven.  Niles checks himself for blood._

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, false alarm.  Normally I bleed like the Russian royal Family, but not today. _While he's been talking Daphne has picked up the chicken that was lying on the floor and put it back on the tray.  She sticks a toothpick in it, which Niles notices._

speaker: Niles
text: Interesting.  You put a toothpick in that chicken.  Now, is that to check when it's done?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no.  I'm just marking which one is yours.  Dr. Crane, would you mind setting the table?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, certainly.  Just give a yell if there's anything else that you need to have grated.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've done enough grating for one night! _Niles walks through to the living room to see Martin sitting at the table writing._

speaker: Niles
text: Writing a letter?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] No, I'm writing my memoirs!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll take that as a Yes.

speaker: Martin
text: My old army buddy.

speaker: Niles
text: [_examining the letter over Martin's shoulder_] You know that's the improper use of a hyphen.

speaker: Martin
text: Somehow I don't think Maurie Dingman will mind.

speaker: Niles
text: Then I'm sure he won't notice that missing comma and that run-on sentence.  Although this is a particularly glaring error.  It's best not to end a sentence with a preposition. _Martin does some scoring out and writing in before handing the letter to Niles to be "marked".  Niles examines the letter._

speaker: Niles
text: Not to be technical, but "Off" is a preposition too!

speaker: Frasier
text: Evening all.

speaker: Niles
text: Good news.  I have tickets for the symphony tomorrow night. Are you free?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually no.  I have a date.

speaker: Martin
text: With who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Some woman I met at my accountant's.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, when I was in the service -- first thing I'd do when I hit a new port was go straight to an accountant and find out where the action was.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must admit I'm having a little trouble working up my enthusiasm about it.  It's not the woman's fault.  It's just that I find myself preoccupied with somebody else right now. Well, frankly, it's gone a bit beyond preoccupation.  I'm having fantasies about her all the time.

speaker: Martin
text: Well there's nothing wrong with that.  You know, when I first met your mother she was so upbeat and bouncy I used to fantasize about her wearing a skimpy little cheerleader's outfit, shaking her pom-poms...

speaker: Martin
text: Grow up you two!  I'm just saying it's perfectly natural. I can't tell you the number of times I was on a stake-out in the cold picturing your mother in front of a warm fire wearing nothing but a...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  One day your mother and I went on a church picnic and the two of you came floating down the river in little wicker baskets!

speaker: Niles
text: Was that so hard?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm beginning to wonder if I have real feelings for this woman?  I mean I think about her all the time.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh this sounds interesting.  Who are we talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate from the office.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, "Dirty Girl."  She seemed nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: She is nice.  Intelligent, accomplished.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if you think so much of her why don't you ask her out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we agreed we wouldn't pursue things.  Frankly, she hasn't given me any indication since that she's even had a second thought about me.

speaker: Niles
text: Added to which, if Frasier did pursue her and she rejected him, he could hardly rationalise it by saying she doesn't know what she's missing.  She would know exactly what she's missing - she just didn't miss it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_staring daggers at Niles_] Thank you, Niles!

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't let fear of rejection stop you Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know Daphne, it's just not that easy really.  Maybe I'm letting this romantic fantasy run away with me.  Truth is we don't really know each other very well and, if she did reject me, I'd end up going to work every day feeling like a fool.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sniffing the air_] Hey, am I getting a whiff of chicken here?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] Oh fine Dad!  Frankly I've had enough of you and your adolescent wisecracks.  I am not "chicken."  I am just merely hesitant.  I will ask her out tomorrow.  Fine.  I hope that makes you happy! [_he storms out the living room_]

speaker: Martin
text: I just thought I smelled dinner! **THE CITY WITH BROAD, BARE SHOULDERS** _Scene 3 -- KACL Kate is standing, waiting for the elevator.  Frasier joins her. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Kate.  Hi.  There you are.  I wanted to talk with you.

speaker: Kate
text: I'm just going down to the Billing department.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll ride along with you. [_both get in the elevator_] You know, it seems every time we speak lately the conversation always leads to ratings, commercials, demographics... _As Frasier continues to talk, Kate starts to daydream about grappling with Frasier on a bed._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...hirings and firings, promotions, demotions, the odd skirmish over the expense account.  It just seems all so dry and impersonal. [_looks at the control panel_] Did I hit the right button?

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, yes!  [_snaps out of it_] Yes.  Yeah.  You did.  You did. You hit the right button.  I'm sorry -- I've got a lot on my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, so do I.  Kate I wanted to ask you�

speaker: Kate
text: Frasier, I'm leaving KACL.  I'm moving to Chicago.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah.  I'm taking over a station there.  In fact I'm going out on the "Redeye" tonight.  I thought, given our history, I should tell you first.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shocked_] Well, I'm at a loss for words.

speaker: Kate
text: Wouldn't you know it -- on the day I'm leaving?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well congratulations.  This is a big step for you.

speaker: Kate
text: Thanks.  Boy, this was not an easy decision believe me. You never know if you're leaving a place too soon.

speaker: Frasier
text: All I know is that for the time you've been here I've certainly enjoyed having you.  [_Frasier realises what he just said and tries to apologise_] Having you...

speaker: Kate
text: I know.  I guess this is goodbye.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose so.  Goodbye, Kate. _They go to kiss but are interrupted and pull back.  Kate heads off, leaving Frasier looking sad in the elevator.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 -- Frasier's apartment Frasier is adjusting his shirt and tie for his date.  Daphne is sitting at the table. _

speaker: Daphne
text: My.  Don't you look dashing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, tell me about this woman you're going out with.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, her name's Donna.  She's an art director.  Or a park director -- I forget.

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, I know you're upset about Kate leaving but cheer up. There's nothing quite as exciting as a first date.  All those questions you ask.  "What's your favourite food?" "What's your favourite colour?" "If you were to come back as an animal, what sort of animal would you be?"  If she were to ask you that one, what would you say?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Cheque please" comes to mind!

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Niles, no one was mean to you last night.  No, if you want to come over, that's great.  Yeah, we'd love to see you. OK.  Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: No traffic?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you sounded lonely so I rented some movies.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, didn't you know the VCR is broken?

speaker: Niles
text: No subtitles this time!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's right, I got it fixed.  What'd you bring?

speaker: Niles
text: I have "The Way We Were" and a classic, "Casablanca."

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I just love that movie.  Is there any more heartbreaking moment in all of film than when Humphrey Bogart tells Ingrid Bergman to get on that plane with Victor Laszlow even though Bogey loves her?  What an ending!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there goes my need to finally see that one.

speaker: Frasier
text: He cares deeply for her and yet he lets her go.  Wonder why Bogey did that?

speaker: Niles
text: Why don't we put the movie in and find out?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because Laszlow needed her by his side to fight the Nazis.

speaker: Martin
text: Forget the Nazis.  No man in his right mind would give up Ingrid Bergman. _By now Niles has both fingers in his ears trying to drown out the conversation._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh sure!  Sacrifice the entire free world for a little Swedish meatball?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I don't like Nazis any more than the next guy but what's Ingrid going to do with Laszlow?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're missing the point.  What makes the movie so romantic is seeing Bogey go from a cynical playboy to a noble self- sacrificing patriot.

speaker: Niles
text: [_throwing the videotape away in disgust_] Oh why don't you just put on some trenchcoats and act it out?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm telling you, if you're in his shoes you've only got one choice.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll say you do.  You get the hell down to the airport and tell her to get off the plane.

speaker: Daphne
text: She's going to Lisbon to fight the Nazis!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing his raincoat and heading for the door_] No, she's not.  She's going to Chicago to turn a Country & Western station into an all-talk format.

speaker: Martin
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Frasier
text: To stop Kate from getting on that plane!

speaker: Martin
text: Well your date's gonna be here in a minute.  What are we supposed to tell her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  Tell her I'm visiting a sick friend or something.  Better yet -- just tell her the truth.  Sometimes two people just aren't meant to be together.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh -- it's just like Redford and Streisand at the end of "The Way We Were."

speaker: Niles
text: [_throwing the second videotape away_] And that's another one down. _FADE TO:  Scene 2 -- Kate's Apartment Frasier knocks on Kate's door and she answers. _

speaker: Kate
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't say anything.  Just listen.  Kate, this afternoon I wanted to say something to you but when I found out you were leaving I held back.  Well, I'm not holding back any more. I can't stop thinking about you.  Not just about the times we made love but about the possibility that we might have a future together.  Now if there's any part of you that wonders the same thing about me, we owe it to ourselves to see it through.  You see, if you get on that plane tonight you'll regret it.  Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but soon and for the rest of our lives.  Anyway I think I made my point. What do you think?

speaker: Tony
text: Kate!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] More importantly, what do you think? _Frasier skulks away.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 -- Frasier's Apartment Niles, Daphne, Martin and Donna (Frasier's date) are all sitting watching Niles's videos. _

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, for God's sake, you've been bawling the whole movie.

speaker: Niles
text: I have not -- my eyes just itch!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it turns out Bogey was right to let her go.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, what are you doing here?  Look, Donna stayed to watch "Casablanca" with us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Donna, hi.

speaker: Donna
text: Hello, Frasier.  How's your friend?

speaker: Martin
text: In the hospital?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he's doing much better actually.  They're thinking of sending him home tomorrow.

speaker: Donna
text: After a heart transplant?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he's with an HMO!  So... er... what do you say we have that dinner?

speaker: Donna
text: Great, I'll just grab my coat. _Donna goes off to get her coat.  The doorbell goes and Frasier answers. It is Kate._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate!

speaker: Kate
text: OK; now you listen to me.  I was so touched by what you just said at my apartment.  You said everything that I've wanted to say to you for the last two months.  Tony's just a guy that I went out with a couple of times.  He just came over to say goodbye to me before I went to the airport.  When you saw him you just looked so hurt...

speaker: Donna
text: You had a date with her tonight too?

speaker: Kate
text: ...but apparently you rebounded!  I'm sorry.  I thought you were sincere.  [_heading off towards the elevator_] Hold the elevator!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate!  I was, Kate!  This woman means nothing to me.

speaker: Donna
text: Thanks a lot!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Donna.  I'm truly sorry.  It was very inconsiderate, but that woman means a great deal to me. I'm sure you'll hate me, but I just gotta do what I gotta do.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm really sorry about this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you stay and watch the end of the movie.

speaker: Donna
text: Thank you, but I've spent quite enough time in this house tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... this is lucky.  We can ride down together. **IT'S HARD TO SAY GOODBYE IF YOU WON'T LEAVE** _Scene 4 -- The Airport Frasier rushes into the departure lounge where Kate is waiting. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate!

speaker: Kate
text: Frasier!  [_she hugs Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God.  I know you're upset.  I don't even care about that woman.  She's just a blind date I didn't even want to go on. I wanted to be with you tonight.

speaker: Kate
text: I know.  I overreacted.  I've been standing here for a half an hour hoping you'd come.  I never thought you'd come.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe I waited so long when all I had to do was say something.

speaker: Kate
text: Listen, it's not your fault.  I could have said something.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_kisses her_] Well it doesn't matter.  We're together now.

speaker: Attendant
text: Your boarding pass, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_letting people go ahead in the queue_] Go ahead.  Go ahead. [_to Kate_] Couldn't you just stay one more night?  Just call them.  Tell them you'll come in tomorrow.

speaker: Kate
text: I can't.  I can't.  I have a board meeting in the morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh damn.  All right I'll call you.  Where are you staying?

speaker: Kate
text: I'm staying at The Drake.  But, you know what?  I'll call you.  I'll call you the minute I get in.

speaker: Attendant
text: Ma'am, we're closing the doors.

speaker: Kate
text: Goodbye

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodbye.  I'll miss you.

speaker: Kate
text: I'll miss you. _Frasier and Kate kiss goodbye and Kate heads off to the plane. As she closes the door behind her a message comes over the Loudspeaker._

speaker: Attendant
text: Ladies and Gentlemen.  I just spoke with our captain and we're having a little technical snag.  So Flight 487 to Chicago will be delayed indefinitely.

speaker: Kate
text: I missed you!

speaker: Frasier
text: I missed you too!  The minute that door closed I started praying for something bad to happen to your plane.

speaker: Kate
text: It's just like fate -- like somebody's willing us to get together.

speaker: Frasier
text: I felt that way since the moment I met you.

speaker: Kate
text: Me too.  Why don't you come with me tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: I gotta work.  I could come out next weekend.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, yeah.  Oh, great.  You know what, you can meet my twin sister.  She lives in Chicago.

speaker: Frasier
text: You've got a twin?

speaker: Kate
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow.  You know there's so much we don't know about each other.

speaker: Kate
text: Well, ask me.  Ask me anything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er... oh, I know.  What's your favourite colour?

speaker: Kate
text: Blue.  What's yours?

speaker: Frasier
text: Arctic silver.  It's available on all the big BMW's.

speaker: Kate
text: Where's your favorite city?

speaker: Frasier
text: Paris!  Museum?

speaker: Kate
text: The Prada!  Musical?

speaker: Frasier
text: _Candide!_  Yours?

speaker: Kate
text: _Cats!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Kate
text: Well I love cats.  I have a cat.  Would you like to meet Louie? [_she points down towards the cat box she has with her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Allergies.  Allergies.  Cats.  Not really much of a pet person.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, really?  Oh, no.  All right, we'll work around that.  You Know, what we can do when you come out?  We can go jogging around the lake.  Oh Frasier, the lake is so beautiful.  Do you ever jog?

speaker: Frasier
text: Once.  In a dark parking lot.  When a truck backfired.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, all right.  We can do something that you like.  What do you like?  What do you like?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we could go antiquing.

speaker: Kate
text: You know what?  I'm not one of those people for whom "antique" is a verb.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Well, this is all good.  The contrasts between us will make our relationship more vibrant.

speaker: Kate
text: Vive la difference!

speaker: Kate
text: [_pointing at the cat box_] Louie's getting to you, isn't he?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  It's all right.

speaker: Kate
text: Well, you know, if this is really gonna be a problem there's a shot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes -- and I understand they're completely humane!  [_Kate stares at him in horror_] Oh, you meant an allergy shot, didn't you? _FADE TO:  Scene 5 -- Still in the airport Frasier is sneezing uncontrollably.  Kate looks on. _

speaker: Kate
text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Frasier.  I'm just afraid that if I move Louie any further away they're gonna think he's a bomb!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right.  It's all right.  So... er... you were saying that you love animals?

speaker: Kate
text: Oh yeah.  I think that's one of the main things that motivates me to work so hard.  I've always had this dream to get a ranch in Montana -- you know?  To ski in the morning and ride horses in the afternoon?  I just always wanted to raise horses.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow, life on a ranch raising horses.  I always pictured myself in a penthouse raising children.

speaker: Kate
text: You still want more children then?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  You like kids?

speaker: Kate
text: Oh yeah.  I love kids.  I don't see myself mothering one, though. _Frasier and Kate both look downhearted as they realise they're not suited._

speaker: Kate
text: [_heading for the desk_] You know, just to be on the safe side let me just check to see if there's another flight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, it couldn't hurt.

speaker: Kate
text: Excuse me -- is there another flight to Chicago tonight?

speaker: Attendant
text: Not until morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: How about on another airline?

speaker: Attendant
text: [_checking the computer_] American has one connecting through Atlanta leaving in 10 minutes.

speaker: Kate
text: Atlanta's good.  That's a hub.

speaker: Attendant
text: Yeah, but they're way on the other side of the airport!

speaker: Kate
text: Oh damn.  I'll never get there.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_noticing an electronic buggy nearby_] Look Kate -- fate to the rescue once again.  [_speaking to the driver as they both get on_] Sir -- this woman has to get across the terminal post-haste.

speaker: Driver
text: Hey pal, this'll go a lot faster with just one person.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good point.  [_kisses Kate goodbye_] Bye.  [_realises they are never going to see each other again_] Pity, though!

speaker: Kate
text: Isn't it? _Frasier is left standing in the departure lounge and notices Louie still in the cat box sitting there.  He picks up Louie and heads out the lounge._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Louie.  This looks like the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
